titleStmt.title: Letter from C.K. Bushe to E.B. Littlehales
titleStmt.author: Bushe, Charles Kendal

availability.p: Reproduction rights owned by Maynooth University Library.

notesStmt.note: This document was created as part of a class project in Autumn 2017 for the Digital Scholarly Editing module under the direction of Professor Susan Schreibman. This module is a component of the MA in Digital Humanities at Maynooth University. Team members were assigned to create a digital scholarly edition from a selection of correspondence in the Littlehales Archive collection at Maynooth University. The team members involved in the creation of the final edition are Monika Barget, James Byrne, Sinéad Greene, Sharon Healy, Michael Kurzmeier, and Lauren Tracy.

sourceDesc.p: The correspondence processed for this digital edition is part of a larger collection, being the Littlehales Archive collection at Maynooth University. The correspondence is dated to 1808, and was written by Edward B. Littlehales, J. Beckett and Charles Bushe.

div.p:
I send you herewith
this little note, you wished to have
— I shall say nothing more, about
about the until I have made
further enquiries.

Substance of a communication made
to a gentleman of credit by a person
who upon former occasions gave him
information which proved to be correct.

He states thaat he has good reason to
believe that a Directory is at present
assembled in Dublin, in correspondence
with France, & in communication with
the Insurgents in Limerick and Kerry

That there has been for some time
past a private intercourse between
France & the disaffected in Dublin
& that an Agent (one of those engaged
in the Rebellion of 1798) has
lately arrived in Ireland from
France on a treasonable mission.

Who this Agent
is, the informed does not at
present know.

ab.p:
Secret
Sir Edward B. Littlehales
Phoenix Park
